author: Staff
title: Israeli police: Jewish man arrested in string of JCC threats
text:
Israeli police: Jewish man arrested in string of JCC threats Updated: March 23, 2017 — 10:06 AM EDT 3 Share 
spokesman Micky Rosenfeld said the Israeli man's motives were unclear. 
& FBI investigation arrest Israeli age 19 suspected of making threats to Jewish organizations, communities & JCC bomb threats in US. 
Micky Rosenfeld (@MickyRosenfeld) March 23, 2017 
targeted Jewish centers in New Jersey, Pennsylvania and Delaware, including those in Cherry Hill and Wynnewood. No bombs were found, but the threats prompted evacuations, rattled nerves and caused unease . 
according to Haaretz . The newspaper reported that the suspect was first linked to a 2016 bomb threat at a Jewish institution in New Zealand and then a similar incident in Australia. 
– Florida, New Jersey, Delaware, Maryland, Tennessee, Georgia, Pennsylvania, South Carolina and North Carolina – also originated in Israel, according to Haaretz. 
fferent computer systems so he couldn't be backtracked," Rosenfeld said. 
including Mount Carmel in Philadelphia's Wissinoming section.
